results.title: USA Rare Earth lines up $1.6 billion in US government funds
results.snippet: USA Rare Earth Inc. signed a non-binding agreement with the Commerce Department for $1.6 billion in funding, the latest White House deal to boost production of rare-earth elements on domestic soil.

results.title: US government investing $1.6 billion in mining company USA Rare Earth
results.snippet: The federal government is injecting $1.6 billion into USA Rare Earth, the latest move by the Trump administration to shore up the domestic supply of rare-earth minerals.

results.title: Trump Administration Takes Another Stake in Rare Earth Sector
results.snippet: The administration announced a $1.6 billion deal with USA Rare Earth. The firm also does business with Cantor Fitzgerald, which is run by the sons of President Trump's commerce secretary.

results.title: More details of USA Rare Earth deal with Trump administration emerge
results.snippet: USA Rare Earth, which is opening a magnet manufacturing plant in Stillwater, said the Trump admin is backing a $1.6B funding package. What to know:

results.title: Heavy rare earths elements separation facility, US
results.snippet: Project Description Aclara Resources is building the US's first heavy rare earths separation facility, which will source feed from Brazil and Chile from mid-2028 to produce high-purity dysprosium, terbium and other restricted HREEs and light rare-earth elements for advanced technologies such as electric vehicles, wind turbines, drones and robotics.

results.title: Trump administration invests in another US rare earth miner to loosen China's grip on supply
results.snippet: Trump administration invests in another US rare earth miner to loosen China's grip on supply - The U.S. is taking a minority stake in an Oklahoma rare earth miner, the latest government investment in the sector as it seeks to minimize its reliance on imports of a material used prevalently in smartphones,

results.title: Cyclic Materials Secures USD $75M Series C Funding to Fast-Track Local and Resilient Rare Earths Supply at Global Scale
results.snippet: Cyclic Materials today announced it has closed an over-subscribed USD $75 million Series C equity round, its largest to date, scaling up operations across the US and Europe and accelerating Canada-based research and development footprint.

results.title: Round Top rare earth elements project, US - update
results.snippet: The pilot process plant will be built in Wheat Ridge, Colorado, in the US, to separate and purify rare earths and other tech metals leached from ore from the project. Project Owner/s Texas Mineral Resources Corp and USA Rare Earth (USAR). The latter has an ...
